issue.title: [C++] Introduce zero-copy "StringPiece" type
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-766](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-766). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This is a pattern used in many Google codebases, like TensorFlow. It can prevent memory allocation from `std::string` in some cases.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-766?focusedCommentId=16696243) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
With https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/948e0fbf9ba94b63d98159ff599585af2841a069 we are vendoring a C++17 `std::string_view` backport, so this is not needed anymore
